"She must have known," he thought, his mind racing. "She must have known what was coming." It was as if her ghost had reached out from beyond the grave to warn him, to prepare him for the emptiness that now filled their home.

He folded the note back up, tucking it into his pocket like a secret. He didn't need anyone else knowing about this, didn't need them intruding on something so personal. They wouldn't understand, couldn't possibly comprehend what it was like to have your wife's words haunt you like this.

As he walked home, the note burning a hole in his pocket, he felt a strange sense of comfort. At least now he knew she'd been thinking about him, even at the end. Even when everything else had seemed so uncertain, her love had been steadfast. He didn't need to hear it from anyone else; he just knew.

It was enough to keep him going, one foot in front of the other, through the empty halls of their once-filled home.
